My mistake, sorry! I added the object to fieldPath and not the string related to the field path :pray:
Now everything works :rocket:

Hey all,
Two quick questions:
1. Is there a quick way to see which CSS classes are applied to any certain module on a page?
2. Is there a fool-proof way to strictly scope modules that use tailwind css? Right now I have a module that has a border coming from somewhere and I can’t figure out where. Looks find locally.
Thanks! Fixing: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/pull/54>

It is strange but even adding that the error persists, although it says typeerror I am not sure it is an error on my side, since if I look for the SSR value it is present. I’m looking for information but I can’t find an alternative yet, if you can think of anything else please let me know.

Just jumping in to +1 configuration for Storybook. Most of my experience is working with React, but not in HubSpot, and Storybook is how I do most of my component development - it’s easier to use than firing up the entire application.
In case anyone needs a workaround for styles - we created a Vite plugin that adds CSS files to the bundle when the build is not production.
I’ve also been using the new form and am pretty pleased with it. Are there docs showing examples of how to use it anywhere? I’m struggling to correctly use a  default formField value.

There's some docs here Josh
<https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/cms-components.html#form>

Can you tell me more about the problem youre seeing
When I upload and use a new module, the default is selected in the sidebar, but doesn’t actually populate the form. I have to  select the form, then apply changes.
Nevermind. Just realized I was using the wrong form id. Works as expected now. :facepalm:
Nice, I was about to ask maybe a typo in form id, no worries!
Is there a way to see the form in the local dev server or storybook? Currently, I’m not seeing the form render, so I’m uploading my changes to see them on <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>
and/or is there a way to `hs watch` for projects?
You using the newer `/preview/module/<name>` local endpoint (vs `/module/<name>`)?
I tried both options, neither is working for me
(Specifically, the module renders, but the form itself doesn’t)

Regarding watch, there is `hs project watch` (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/project-cli-commands#watch-for-changes>) but we haven’t recommended that workflow as much since the build & deploy can take 20-60s+ (mostly dependent on how many npm deps the project brings in). Ideally the proxy workflow would cover most all cases testing the components against live pages, but we have not implemented a few things necessary to make this new form component work in the proxy case yet :grimacing:
Thank you for the update on using watch. I wasn’t able to get it working regardless, but now I know better than to continue down that track.
I'll look into reproducing/fixing the issue youre seeing Josh on the preview/module route, thanks for report
For anyone else looking for an answer, this was also asked in <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1713986980552189?thread_ts=1712864379.758569&cid=C04AY1H2204|this thread>.
